intro: Pleconax conica subsp. amphorina, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pleconax, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, cylindrical stem and narrow, elongated leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Its unique morphology and ecological preferences make it a notable species in its native range.
